TopicTitle: Want to completely break your framerate? I dare you...

Articles.Content:
... to build something like this: A giant space cruiser with working escape pods and a complete custom built interior with access shafts, engineering deck etc.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Want to try it out? Warning, it is known to make some computers crash

http://www./download/z6yn3gcjtsyjbyy/K-Star_Supreme_test.craft

EDIT:

I managed to weld it so you could possibly use it without breaking your computer.

Copy .craft file into your savegame. Copy UbioWeld Folder into your GameData folder (it contains the welded parts)

http://www./download/q56fvr47e7nahou/K-Star_UbioWeld_Parts.zip

Edited February 11, 2015 by ShadowZone
craft file!
That is beyond glorious.
Amazing. I really wish things like this were more practical, that interior is great.
Epic build! How many... days?
so much lag

*Bows down in awe*

I killed ksp.exe when I saw little smoke puffs coming from the fan.
How far could you cut dow on the part count with welding, and still have everything function?

Epic build! How many... days?

I believe two or three. Main problem was lag buildup in the SPH. When you load the craft it's okay, but it gets worse the money you tinker around. Had to restart the game ever 15 min or so.

EDIT:

How far could you cut dow on the part count with welding, and still have everything function?

Well I tried to weld the hull segments. This is what happened:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107273-0-90-UbioZur-Welding-Ltd-Continued-2-1-1-%282015-01-14%29?p=1725028&viewfull=1#post1725028

Edited February 10, 2015 by ShadowZone
included another reply
The video is great except the ladder part

This belongs in the Spacecraft Exchange, moving.

Awesome craft, ShadowZone, you must have put a lot of time into building it.
A spaceship worthy of Jeb, well done, have rep
This would be a good addition to the Multi-hulled and Exotic designs thread! Amazing interior! Although I am dissapointed by the lack of bulkheads...
summon welding tool
I actually am doing that at the moment. Got the part count down to a little over 600 at the moment. Stay tuned
Amazing! I wish I had the patience to do something like this.
+rep Amazing man!
Update: With the welding mod I got the part count down to 564. Framerate ranges from 4 to 9 at the moment. Maybe I can improve that a little... not sure how far though.
My God this is absolutely beautiful. Makes me want to be a new computer just for this!

Thanks to everyone for your kind feedback. It makes all of the tedious work really worth it

Made a welded version and put it in the original post. With 570 parts instead of >1700 it's actually usable.
This is abolutely amazing. Personally I think the escape pods are the best bit. I'd never thought of using ion powered escape pods. Are they good enough to de-orbit the pods to Kerbin?

This is abolutely amazing. Personally I think the escape pods are the best bit. I'd never thought of using ion powered escape pods. Are they good enough to de-orbit the pods to Kerbin?

No those pods are designed to get stranded Kerbals from anywhere in the solar system back to Kerbin orbit where they would be picked up by a rescue mission. I would not advise trying to land one of these things. Although... you could attach a chute and it would probably land safely.
Duuuude.... What are your PC specs? Your computer must be running god mode to run something like that without lag O_O
